text: Trapania darvelli is a species of sea slug, a dorid nudibranch, a marine gastropod mollusc in the family Goniodorididae.Bouchet, P. (2015). Trapania darvelli. In: MolluscaBase (2015). Accessed through: World Register of Marine Species on 2015-10-19 ==Distribution== This species was described from Hong Kong. It has also been reported from Sabah, Malaysia and Honiara, Solomon Islands which suggests a wide distribution in the central Indo-Pacific region. This species has also been photographed in the PhilippinesBehrens, D., 2009. Trapania darvelli. At: The Slug Site, Michael D. Miller and Taiwan.Connie Chen Trapania darvelli. Flickr] ==Description== This goniodorid nudibranch is translucent white frosted with opaque white pigment on the body. The rhinophores, gills, oral tentacles and lateral papillae are chocolate brown. The lateral papillae are unusually large in this species, with a swollen appearance.Rudman, W.B., 2001 (July 5) Trapania darvelli Rudman, 1987. [In] Sea Slug Forum. Australian Museum, Sydney. ==Ecology== Trapania darvelli probably feeds on Entoprocta which often grow on sponges and other living substrata. ==References== Category:Goniodorididae Category:Gastropods described in 1987
title: Trapania darvelli
